newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices weaker on CBOT slide.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices weaker on CBOT slide.

text.p: U.S. millfeed prices were mostly steady to lower on Thursday in line with declining CBOT corn and soybean prices and an easing of nearby supply tightness, dealers said.
With the corn market down, midds were slightly off, a Carolinas dealer said. The price of midds are too high. "They are going to break. It is a question of when and how far," he said.
"It is dead quiet and until the feed business gets better, the market is definitely top heavy," one St Louis dealer said. "There is more feed around than what the market needs."
Spot Kansas City prices dropped $1.00 to bid at $96.00 a ton and offer at $98.00 and Chattanooga values fell $3.00 to bid at $90.00 and offer at $94.

"We are still in this holding pattern," a Minneapolis dealer said. "Buyers are waiting for the midds to go as low as they can go." Minneapolis spot values were off $2.00 to bid at $85.00 and offer at $90.00.
"I think the nearby supply tightness is gone," he added. "You can get feed if you need it."
Millfeed prices appeared to be high, a dealer said.

He noted two factors that will maintain millfeed prices, cold weather demand and a seasonal cutback in mill run times as they get beyond the middle of November. "Too many people will be going to corn and away from midds," he said.
